intro: Silene scabriflora var. tuberculata, commonly known as the roughleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Silene scabriflora var. tuberculata is a perennial species with a low-growing habit and is adapted to arid environments.
